pullRequest.body:
Add a few lemmas, golf the existing ones and update the docstrings to something more precise


---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

It looks like this PR does far more than the title or description describe. Did you merge two PRs by accident?
Yes, not sure how it happened as I never any merge button... Should be fixed now

I have modified your PR title to follow the conventions, which you can read about here: https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/commit.html#format. Please ensure to follow these in the future!

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11148477019/job/30985176197)

bors d+
Thanks!

bors d+
Thanks!

```suggestion
/-- As `sSup s = 0` when `s` is a set of reals that's empty,
it suffices to show that all elements of `s` are at most some nonnegative number `a` to show that
`sSup s ≤ a`. -/
```
or something like this mentioning the unbounded above case is confusing here since the assumption already excludes that case. Similarly below
Let's also reference `csSup_le` here for ease of use. Similar below.

```suggestion
/-- As `⨆ i, f i = 0` when the domain of `f` is empty, it suffices to show that all values of `f`
```
"the empty function" is too ambiguous for a docstring!
the line break here looks strange
I tried a semantic line-break 🤷
I think a docstring like this should mention the fact that `f` is real valued, like the previous one

What's the purpose for this change? It looks either
a) unnecessary in this PR
b) a sign that the new API is less explicit
I think it's neither. Unification seems quite fragile here, as `sSup` was now getting unfolded to its definition even though no change in the API should have caused this.

I don't see the point of putting this on one line: it just makes it harder to see when the statement stops and when the proof starts. In general, unless the proof is `rfl` or `by simp`, I like it better on a separate line even if it would fit on one line. Same thing several times in the PR.

```suggestion
that all values of `f` are at least some nonpositive number `a` to show that `a ≤ ⨅ i, f i`.
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(Data/Real/Archimedean): `sSup`/`sInf` API cleanup
